segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 1.0
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 1.0

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 1.0
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 1.0

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 1.0
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 1.0

segment.source: Before you deploy Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) into a production environment, you should evaluate it in a lab environment.
segment.target: Before you deploy Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) into a production environment, you should evaluate it in a lab environment.

segment.source: You can use the information in this topic to set up MBAM in a single server lab environment for evaluation purposes only.
segment.target: You can use the information in this topic to set up MBAM in a single server lab environment for evaluation purposes only.

segment.source: While the actual deployment steps are very similar to the scenario that is described in How to Install and Configure MBAM on a Single Server, this topic contains additional information to enable you to set up an MBAM evaluation environment in the least amount of time.
segment.target: While the actual deployment steps are very similar to the scenario that is described in How to Install and Configure MBAM on a Single Server, this topic contains additional information to enable you to set up an MBAM evaluation environment in the least amount of time.

segment.source: Set up the Lab Environment
segment.target: Set up the Lab Environment

segment.source: Even when you set up a non-production instance of MBAM to evaluate in a lab environment, you should still verify that you have met the deployment prerequisites and the hardware and software requirements.
segment.target: Even when you set up a non-production instance of MBAM to evaluate in a lab environment, you should still verify that you have met the deployment prerequisites and the hardware and software requirements.

segment.source: For more information, see MBAM 1.0 Deployment Prerequisites and MBAM 1.0 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: For more information, see MBAM 1.0 Deployment Prerequisites and MBAM 1.0 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: You should also review Preparing your Environment for MBAM 1.0 before you begin the MBAM evaluation deployment.
segment.target: You should also review Preparing your Environment for MBAM 1.0 before you begin the MBAM evaluation deployment.

segment.source: Plan for an MBAM Evaluation Deployment
segment.target: Plan for an MBAM Evaluation Deployment

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: References
segment.target: References

segment.source: Notes
segment.target: Notes

segment.source: Review the Getting Started information about MBAM to gain a basic understanding of the product before you begin your deployment planning.
segment.target: Review the Getting Started information about MBAM to gain a basic understanding of the product before you begin your deployment planning.

segment.source: Getting Started with MBAM 1.0
segment.target: Getting Started with MBAM 1.0

segment.source: Prepare your computing environment for the MBAM installation.
segment.target: Prepare your computing environment for the MBAM installation.

segment.source: To do so, you must enable the Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) on the SQL Server instances that will host MBAM databases.
segment.target: To do so, you must enable the Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) on the SQL Server instances that will host MBAM databases.

segment.source: To enable TDE in your lab environment, you can create a .sql file to run against the master database that is hosted on the instance of the SQL Server that MBAM will use.
segment.target: To enable TDE in your lab environment, you can create a .sql file to run against the master database that is hosted on the instance of the SQL Server that MBAM will use.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can use the following example to create a .sql file for your lab environment to quickly enable TDE on the SQL Server instance that will host the MBAM databases.
segment.target: You can use the following example to create a .sql file for your lab environment to quickly enable TDE on the SQL Server instance that will host the MBAM databases.

segment.source: These SQL Server commands will enable TDE by using a locally signed SQL Server certificate.
segment.target: These SQL Server commands will enable TDE by using a locally signed SQL Server certificate.

segment.source: Make sure to back up the TDE certificate and its associated encryption key to the example local backup path of C:\Backup\.
segment.target: Make sure to back up the TDE certificate and its associated encryption key to the example local backup path of C:\Backup\.

segment.source: The TDE certificate and key are required when recover the database or move the certificate and key to another server that has TDE encryption in place.
segment.target: The TDE certificate and key are required when recover the database or move the certificate and key to another server that has TDE encryption in place.

segment.source: Perform an MBAM Evaluation Deployment
segment.target: Perform an MBAM Evaluation Deployment

segment.source: After you complete the necessary planning and software prerequisite installations to prepare your computing environment for an MBAM installation, you can begin the MBAM evaluation deployment.
segment.target: After you complete the necessary planning and software prerequisite installations to prepare your computing environment for an MBAM installation, you can begin the MBAM evaluation deployment.

segment.source: Review the MBAM supported configurations information to make sure that the selected client and server computers are supported for the MBAM feature installation.
segment.target: Review the MBAM supported configurations information to make sure that the selected client and server computers are supported for the MBAM feature installation.

segment.source: MBAM 1.0 Supported Configurations
segment.target: MBAM 1.0 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup to deploy MBAM Server features on a single server for evaluation purposes.
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup to deploy MBAM Server features on a single server for evaluation purposes.

segment.source: How to Install and Configure MBAM on a Single Server
segment.target: How to Install and Configure MBAM on a Single Server

segment.source: Add the Active Directory Domain Services security groups that you created during the planning phase to the appropriate local MBAM Server feature local groups on the new MBAM server.
segment.target: Add the Active Directory Domain Services security groups that you created during the planning phase to the appropriate local MBAM Server feature local groups on the new MBAM server.

segment.target: Create and deploy the required MBAM Group Policy Objects.

segment.source: Configure Lab Computers for MBAM Evaluation
segment.target: Configure Lab Computers for MBAM Evaluation

segment.source: You can change the frequency settings on the MBAM Client status reporting by using Registry Editor.
segment.target: You can change the frequency settings on the MBAM Client status reporting by using Registry Editor.

segment.source: However, these modifications should be used for testing purposes only.
segment.target: However, these modifications should be used for testing purposes only.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: This topic describes how to change the Windows registry by using Registry Editor.
segment.target: This topic describes how to change the Windows registry by using Registry Editor.

segment.source: If you change the Windows registry incorrectly, you can cause serious problems that might require you to reinstall Windows.
segment.target: If you change the Windows registry incorrectly, you can cause serious problems that might require you to reinstall Windows.

segment.source: You should make a backup copy of the registry files (System.dat and User.dat) before you change the registry.
segment.target: You should make a backup copy of the registry files (System.dat and User.dat) before you change the registry.

segment.source: Microsoft cannot guarantee that the problems that might occur when you change the registry can be resolved.
segment.target: Microsoft cannot guarantee that the problems that might occur when you change the registry can be resolved.

segment.source: Change the registry at your own risk.
segment.target: Change the registry at your own risk.

segment.source: Modify the Frequency Settings on MBAM Client Status Reporting
segment.target: Modify the Frequency Settings on MBAM Client Status Reporting

segment.source: The MBAM Client wakeup and status reporting frequencies have a minimum value of 90 minutes when they are set to use Group Policy.
segment.target: The MBAM Client wakeup and status reporting frequencies have a minimum value of 90 minutes when they are set to use Group Policy.

segment.source: You can change these frequencies on MBAM client computers by editing the Windows registry to lower values, which will help speed up the testing.
segment.target: You can change these frequencies on MBAM client computers by editing the Windows registry to lower values, which will help speed up the testing.

segment.source: To modify the frequency settings on MBAM Client status reporting, use a registry editor to navigate to HKLMSoftwarePoliciesFVEMDOPBitLockerManagement, change the values for ClientWakeupFrequency and StatusReportingFrequency to 1 as the minimum client supported value, and then restart BitLocker Management Client Service.
segment.target: To modify the frequency settings on MBAM Client status reporting, use a registry editor to navigate to HKLMSoftwarePoliciesFVEMDOPBitLockerManagement, change the values for ClientWakeupFrequency and StatusReportingFrequency to 1 as the minimum client supported value, and then restart BitLocker Management Client Service.

segment.source: When you make this change, the MBAM Client will report every minute.
segment.target: When you make this change, the MBAM Client will report every minute.

segment.source: You can set values this low only when you do so manually in the registry.
segment.target: You can set values this low only when you do so manually in the registry.

segment.source: Modify the Startup Delay on MBAM Client Service
segment.target: Modify the Startup Delay on MBAM Client Service

segment.source: In addition to the MBAM Client wakeup and status reporting frequencies, there is a random delay of up to 90 minutes when the MBAM Client agent service starts on client computers.
segment.target: In addition to the MBAM Client wakeup and status reporting frequencies, there is a random delay of up to 90 minutes when the MBAM Client agent service starts on client computers.

segment.source: If you do not want the random delay, create a DWORD value of NoStartupDelay under HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftMBAM, set its value to 1, and then restart BitLocker Management Client Service.
segment.target: If you do not want the random delay, create a DWORD value of NoStartupDelay under HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftMBAM, set its value to 1, and then restart BitLocker Management Client Service.
